section.title: WeBWorK Assignments
section.p: I have made an account for you on an online homework platform called . You can access using the navbar in our D2L course. Each week there are problem sets and you are required to answer them online in . Each problem set is due at 10:00 on Sunday at the end of that module's week. You may submit answers any time before the due date.

paragraphs.title: Late Work
paragraphs.p: After a due date, you still have up to two weeks to answer exercises and get 95% credit. It's usually a two-week window, however the window is shorter right before the midterm or final exam. The idea is that you really should complete all homework before coming in to take an exam.

paragraphs.title: Emailing for Help
paragraphs.p: When you are stumped, you can click the Email Instructor button at the bottom of any problem. Write a message explaining what you have tried and if possible, include the work from your calculations. will send me (your instructor) an email with helpful information (like all of the incorrect attempts you have tried) and I will get back to you soon with a response. When I respond, it will be with an email, so you must remember to check your own email.

paragraphs.title: Math Achievements
paragraphs.p: As you complete more problems, you win badges for various achievements. For example, the On One Hand badge is for completing a homework set with fewer than five incorrect submissions. Both earning badges and just plain answering questions correctly will earn you achievement points. As you gain more achievement points, you will level up. Each time you level up, you earn an item that can be used to affect your grade.
